publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1549 Dr Winnie Ewing: Lead in Drinking Water—That the Parliament wholeheartedly agrees with the Scottish House Builders Association that lead solder is no longer needed in household plumbing and believes that legislation should be introduced to impose bans on the use and sale of lead solder, thereby limiting the health concerns over lead in drinking water supplies.
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Alex Neil*
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Colin Campbell*, Shona Robison*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Tommy Sheridan*

S1M-1549 Dr Winnie Ewing: Lead in Drinking Water—That the Parliament wholeheartedly agrees with the Scottish House Builders Association that lead solder is no longer needed in household plumbing and believes that legislation should be introduced to impose bans on the use and sale of lead solder, thereby limiting the health concerns over lead in drinking water supplies. Supported by: Alex Neil, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Linda Fabiani*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Irene McGugan*, Michael Russell*, Alasdair Morgan*, Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Hugh Henry*, Dennis Canavan*, Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1549 Dr Winnie Ewing: Lead in Drinking Water—That the Parliament wholeheartedly agrees with the Scottish House Builders Association that lead solder is no longer needed in household plumbing and believes that legislation should be introduced to impose bans on the use and sale of lead solder, thereby limiting the health concerns over lead in drinking water supplies. Supported by: Alex Neil, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Alasdair Morgan, Roseanna Cunningham, Hugh Henry, Dennis Canavan, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame*

S1M-1549 Lead in Drinking Water (lodged on 16 January 2001) Brian Adam*

S1M-1549 Dr Winnie Ewing: Lead in Drinking Water—That the Parliament wholeheartedly agrees with the Scottish House Builders Association that lead solder is no longer needed in household plumbing and believes that legislation should be introduced to impose bans on the use and sale of lead solder, thereby limiting the health concerns over lead in drinking water supplies. Supported by: Alex Neil, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Linda Fabiani, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Alasdair Morgan, Roseanna Cunningham, Hugh Henry, Dennis Canavan, Nora Radcliffe, Christine Grahame, Fergus Ewing, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Tricia Marwick, Ms Sandra White, Brian Adam
